discussion.content: correct YES|NO|YES

:

 User3 must use the Microsoft Teams client to initiate a new chat with User1. - Yes
 Reasoning: User3 is set to Teams only mode, so they must use Teams for all communications, including initiating a new chat with User1.

 User1 must use the Microsoft Teams client to initiate a new chat with User2. - No
 Reasoning: User1 is set to use Org-wide settings, which is currently set to Islands mode. In Islands mode, a user can use either Teams or Skype for Business to initiate a new chat.

 User2 must use the Skype for Business client to initiate a new chat with User1 and User3. - No
 Reasoning: User2 is set to Skype for Business with Teams collaboration mode. This means they can use Teams for team collaboration but should use Skype for Business for chat, meetings, and calling with other users who are still using Skype for Business. However, since User3 is in Teams only mode, User2 should use Teams to chat with User3.

discussion.content:
# 3 is a NO,
If you upgraded from Skype for Business to Teams and your users are in Teams Only mode, chats and calls from Skype users to Teams users are delivered to Teams. If your users are in Islands mode, chats and calls from Skype users to Teams users are delivered to Skype for Business.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/teams-skype-interop

Yes > User3 coexistence mode is Teams only. The User can only use Teams for a new Chat with User1.

Definitely NO > User1 coexistence mode is Islands AND is Homed ON Prem. The User MUST Use Skype for Business to initiate instead of Teams otherwise there is no communication (see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/coexistence-chat-calls-presence)

NO > see Table here as well https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/coexistence-chat-calls-presence)

YES/YES/NO
• Islands - Use this setting if you want users to be able to use both Skype for Business and Teams simultaneously.
• Skype for Business only - Use this setting if you want your users to only use Skype for Business.
• Skype for Business with Teams collaboration - Use this setting if you want your users to use Skype for Business in addition to using Teams for group collaboration (channels).
• Skype for Business with Teams collaboration and meetings - Use this setting if you want your users to use Skype for Business in addition to using Teams for group collaboration (channels) and Teams meetings.
• Teams only - Use this setting if you want your users to use only Teams. Note that even with this setting, users can still join meetings hosted in Skype for Business.

Yes - User3 must use teams only, because user3 is in "Teams only" mode

No - User1 must NOT use Teams, because user2 is in "Skype for business with Teams collaboration" mode
"Teams private chat, calling, and scheduling meetings are off by default in this mode."

No - because despite being able to chat with user1 (Islands mode) User3 is in "Teams only" mode

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that uses Microsoft Teams and a hybrid deployment of Microsoft Skype for Business Server.
Coexistence mode in Microsoft Teams is set to Islands.
Coexistence mode is configured for three users named User1, User2, and User3 as shown in the following table.
//IMG//

The Skype for Business user accounts are homed as shown in the following table.
//IMG//

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that uses Teams.

You have a template to create a team named Team1.

You need to modify the template so that only Team1 owners can delete channels and messages.

How should you complete the template? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: owners should be able to delete by default so this given answer looks correct. They have also set the owners already in the message section to true

Correct : When you assign a policy to a group, you specify a ranking for the group assignment. This ranking is used to determine which policy a user should inherit as their effective policy if the user is a member of two or more groups and each group is assigned a policy of the same type.

The group assignment ranking is relative to other group assignments of the same type. For example, if you're assigning a calling policy to two groups, set the ranking of one assignment to 1 and the other to 2, with 1 being the highest ranking. The group assignment ranking indicates which group membership is more important or more relevant than other group memberships regarding inheritance. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/assign-policies-users-and-groups#precedence-rules
yes rank1

If a user doesn't have a policy directly assigned to them and is a member of two or more groups and each group has a policy of the same type assigned to it, the user inherits the policy of the group assignment that has the highest ranking.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/assign-policies-users-and-groups#precedence-rules

questions.question_text:
Your company uses Teams Calling Plans.

When a user places a Teams call to an ambulance service, you need to ensure that a notification is also sent to the main receptionist of the company.

What should you configure?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It´s correct

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/what-are-emergency-locations-addresses-and-call-routing

"You use a Teams emergency calling policy (TeamsEmergencyCallingPolicy) to configure who should be notified during an emergency call and how they are notified: chat only, conferenced in and muted, or conferenced in and muted but with the ability to unmute. You can also specify an external PSTN number of a user or group to call and join the emergency call. Note that the PSTN party is not allowed to unmute"
